description: `Connected' alternating sign n X n matrices, i.e. not made from smaller blocks.
comments: A003827 factors out the singleton components only, but many alternating sign matrices can be decomposed into larger pieces.
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..90
formula: Sum[a[k]z^k/k!^2, {k, 0, Infinity}]=Log[Sum[r[k]z^k/k!^2, {k, 0, Infinity}] where r[k] is the k-th Robbins number A005130[n].a[n] = r[n]-(1/n)*sum{k=0..n-1}k*C(n, k)^2*r[n-k]*a[k], n>0, a[0]=0, where c(n, k) is binomial coefficient and r[k] is the k-th Robbins number A005130[n]. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Mar 16 2000
mathematica: r[n_] = Product[(3k+1)!/(n+k)!, {k, 0, n-1}] ; a[n_] := a[n] = r[n] - (1/n)*Sum[k*Binomial[n, k]^2*r[n-k]*a[k], {k, 0, n-1}]; a[0] = 0; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 16}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Aug 01 2011, after V. Jovovic *)
author: _Don Knuth_
